intro: Ichthyothere perfoliata, commonly known as the water nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found near water bodies such as ponds and streams. The plant is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin.
